feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically computes and deducts daily pay rates for employees taking unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month, accounting for public holidays and leave policy type (calendar or working days). Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the system automatically generates a corresponding pay deduction reflected on the payroll table. This feature ensures accurate and consistent salary reductions based on the organization's leave policy and statutory holidays. It streamlines payroll administration by automating calculations that would otherwise require manual computation.

source_articles_index.title: How is daily pay calculated
source_articles_index.article_summary: This article explains how daily pay is calculated for unpaid leave deductions. It defines the formula (Daily Pay = Salary Amount [Basic + Allowance] / Actual Working Days), describes the distinction between calendar days and working days leave policies, and specifies that public holidays must be subtracted from working days to determine the actual working days used in the calculation. The article confirms that upon approval of an unpaid leave request, an automatic pay deduction is created and reflected on the payroll table.

source_articles_index.title: Introduction to daily wage calculator
source_articles_index.article_summary: Introduces the Daily Wage Calculator feature, explaining its purpose to provide flexible and customizable daily wage calculation methods. Describes three calculation bases (calendar days, working days, custom days), salary component selection options, and the three main payroll areas it impacts (salary proration, leave encashment, unpaid leave deduction). Identifies user roles (Superadmin, Payroll table managers, transaction processors) and navigation path (Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation). Highlights regional labor law compliance, particularly for UAE and KSA companies using 30-day months.

source_articles_index.title: Salary Proration
source_articles_index.article_summary: This article explains how to update salary proration in the Daily Wage Calculator (DWC). It covers the navigation path (Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation), the three available calculation bases (custom days, calendar days, working days), and the critical workflow for handling existing prorated transactions when the payroll month is open. The feature affects all active unpaid payroll amounts and is accessible only to Super admins.

procedures.procedure_name: Calculate Daily Pay for Unpaid Leave
procedures.when_to_use: When an unpaid leave request has been approved and a salary deduction must be calculated and applied to payroll.
steps: Receive and approve the unpaid leave request
Identify the leave policy type (calendar days or working days)
Determine the total number of days in the policy (e.g., 30 calendar days or 22 working days)
Identify all public holidays falling in the month of the unpaid leave
Subtract public holidays from the total working days to calculate actual working days
Obtain the employee's total salary amount (basic salary plus allowances)
Apply the formula: Daily Pay = Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) / Actual Working Days
The system automatically creates and reflects the pay deduction on the payroll table

procedures.when_to_use: When setting up or modifying how the organization calculates daily wages for payroll purposes.
steps: Navigate to Settings menu
Select Payroll option
Choose Daily Wage Calculation
Select calculation base: calendar days, working days, or custom days
Choose salary components to include: basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only
Apply configuration to impact salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations

procedures.when_to_use: When adjusting how employee salaries are calculated based on days worked, particularly for first salaries and end-of-service settlements
steps: Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation
Select calculation basis from available options: custom days, calendar days, or working days
Make necessary changes according to required calculation bases
Save changes
If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions before saving new proration settings
Confirm new proration settings are applied

rules_limitations_constraints.rule: Daily pay formula: Daily Pay = Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) / Number of actual working days in the month. The number of days is determined by the leave policy (calendar days or working days). ; Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days count to calculate actual working days for the daily pay calculation. ; Only approved unpaid leave requests trigger automatic pay deduction creation; unapproved requests do not generate deductions.

Calendar days calculation uses the actual number of days in each month (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February). ; Working days calculation excludes weekends and public holidays as defined in the company's public holiday calendar. ; Custom days allows organizations to set a fixed number of calculation days; most UAE and KSA companies use 30 days to comply with regional labor laws that define a month as 30 days. ; Only Superadmins, Payroll table managers, or transaction processors can select and modify the calculation base.

Changes to salary proration will affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table ; When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject the transactions with prorated salaries before saving changes to salary proration settings
